elements.title: Lyndon B. Johnson's 1964 presidential campaign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although the "Daisy" advertisement (pictured) was aired only once, it is considered to be one of the most important factors for victory in Lyndon B. Johnson's 1964 presidential campaign?

elements.title: Joan Boada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joan Boada was named a principal dancer at the Cuban National Ballet at age 16, but later defected and ended up at the San Francisco Ballet?

elements.title: Battle of Hancock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the temperature was 0 °F (−18 °C) on the morning that the Battle of Hancock began?

elements.title: James Chappell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James Chappell is thought to have been the first black landlord of an English public house?

elements.title: The Yankee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "the very first words of encouragement [Edgar Allan Poe] ever remember[ed] to have heard" were in The Yankee?

elements.title: Hedda Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Swedish writer Hedda Anderson began her literary career at the age of 58, following her husband's death in 1888?

elements.title: nine consecutive titles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prior to winning their first of nine consecutive titles in the 1965–66 season, Celtic had not been champions of the Scottish Football League for 12 years?

elements.title: Rosalie Carey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patric and Rosalie Carey built New Zealand's first theatre for professional repertory on the back of their house?
